content:
Sure, here's an example of a datastore model for the `Comment` entity:
```python
from google.cloud import ndb

class Comment(ndb.Model):
    author = ndb.StringProperty(required=True)
    content = ndb.StringProperty(required=True)
    created = ndb.DateTimeProperty(auto_now_add=True)
```
In this example, the `Comment` entity has three properties: `author`, `content`, and `created`. The `author` property is a required string property that specifies the name of the user who created the comment. The `content` property is a required string property that contains the text of the comment. The `created` property is a DateTimeProperty that automatically sets the time that the comment was created to the current time when the entity is created.

You could add additional properties to the `Comment` entity as needed, depending on the requirements of your application.
